e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and inclusivity. In this context, ABC's EPS should be reported truthfully, reflecting actual performance without intentional bias or rounding considerations for investors with varying levels of sophistication to make informed decisions. The report should aim to maintain consistency without compromising integrity or credibility, allowing stakeholders (especially novice investors) to confidently evaluate and predict firm's future financial performances.
e6: Yes. I would follow up on metrics to specifically measure how well investors were informed about the policy change, both in terms of the total population and particularly novice investors, and then evaluating the impact on stock performance over several quarters or maybe even years into the future so as best make accurate judgement based factual data .
